page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: Besides excellent road links with nearby towns and its proximity to the M6 Motorway,Sandbach and Elworth are well-served by a good rail link. The village of Elworth has its own railway station.This lies on the main Manchester to Crewe line and is, therefore,of great benefit to commuters working in Manchester or to shoppers travelling to major towns or cities for the day.Crewe,itself,only five miles from Sandbach,is easily reached and from there rail connections may be made to any part of the country served by the railway network. A further feature of the area is the Trent and Mersey Canal.Although of little commercial significance nowadays it is well-used by holiday boats and is well-maintained by the British Waterways Board.
